block.p: Allyson Tucker, an actress and a dancer in New York, was married yesterday to Brian Stokes Mitchell, an actor and a composer, also in New York. The Rev. James Hicks, a Methodist minister, officiated at the home of the bride's parents, Dr. and Mrs. Erskine R. Tucker, in River Hills, Wis. The Rev. David Sharp, a Presbyterian minister, took part in the ceremony.

Mrs. Tucker-Mitchell, who appeared on Broadway in "The Will Rogers Follies" and "Oh, Kay," most recently performed in "Anything Goes" at Theaterfest in Montclair, N.J. She graduated from Brown University and is a law student at Georgetown University. Her father retired as a pathologist at St. Francis Hospital in Milwaukee.

Allyson Tucker, an actress and a dancer in New York, was married yesterday to Brian Stokes Mitchell, an actor and a composer, also in New York. The Rev. James Hicks, a Methodist minister, officiated at the home of the bride's parents, Dr. and Mrs. Erskine R. Tucker, in River Hills, Wis. The Rev. David Sharp, a Presbyterian minister, took part in the ceremony.

Mrs. Tucker-Mitchell, who appeared on Broadway in "The Will Rogers Follies" and "Oh, Kay," most recently performed in "Anything Goes" at Theaterfest in Montclair, N.J. She graduated from Brown University and is a law student at Georgetown University. Her father retired as a pathologist at St. Francis Hospital in Milwaukee.

Mr. Mitchell, who stars as Valentin in "Kiss of the Spider Woman" on Broadway, also played the title role in "Jelly's Last Jam" and has a recurring role on "The Fresh Prince of Bel Air" on NBC-TV. He is a son of George T. Mitchell of San Diego and the late Lillian Mitchell. His mother was a director of the volunteer program for the San Diego Unified School District. His father, an electronics engineer, retired as a radio officer at the Scripps Institute of Oceanography in San Diego. WEDDINGS
